title: 114_s16
content: The Act titled "No Exemption for Washington from Obamacare Act" mandates health insurance coverage for certain congressional staff and members of the executive branch. Section 1312(d)(3)(D) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to include members of congress, congressional staff, and political appointees in the health insurance exchange. In section 1312(d)(3)(D) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, political appointees are defined as individuals employed in specific positions under title 5 of the United States Code. The curr_chunk defines individuals as limited term appointees, limited emergency appointees, or noncareer appointees in the Senior Executive Service, as well as those employed in executive branch positions of a confidential or policy-determining character. The curr_chunk adds criteria for individuals employed in executive branch positions of a confidential, policy-determining, policy-making, or policy-advocating character under specific regulations. The curr_chunk specifies that no Government contribution shall be provided for certain individuals, including Members of Congress, congressional staff members, the President, the Vice President, or political appointees, for health insurance coverage. Additionally, individuals enrolling in coverage under this paragraph are not eligible for tax credits under section 36B of the Internal Revenue Code. The curr_chunk states that Members of Congress cannot have discretion in determining which employees can enroll for coverage through an Exchange.
